alert.note: Alert for Matanuska Valley (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Storm Watch issued December 24 at 10:21AM AKST until December 27 at 6:00AM AKST by NWS Anchorage
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WATCH IN EFFECT FROM SUNDAY MORNING THROUGH EARLY MONDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Snow and significant icing from freezing rain possible. Total snow accumulations of up to 4 inches north and east of Palmer, including Sutton and Chickaloon, with ice accumulations of up to three tenths of an inch possible for the entire Valley. * WHERE...Matanuska Valley. * WHEN...From Sunday morning through early Monday morning. * IMPACTS...Power outages and tree damage are possible due to the ice. Travel could be extremely hazardous. The hazardous conditions could impact holiday travel on Sunday and the Monday morning commute. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Snow starting early Sunday morning will transition to freezing rain through the afternoon from southwest to northeast as warm air moving in aloft melts falling snow and temperatures remain below freezing at the ground. * Confidence is high that there will be periods of freezing rain, but much lower on amounts and the timing. Stay tuned for additional forecast updates.
info.instruction: Monitor the latest forecasts for updates on this situation.
